sometimes hear native speakers using a
different order but this is generally
the order that we use it's quite long
but it goes as the following first we
would say our opinion opinion first
something is ugly or gorgeous then we
would say the size of the noun big tiny
then we would say the shape fat round
then we would say the condition broken
dirty and we would say the age ancient
new for example then the color red white
you guys know the color then the pattern
spotty striped then we would say the
origin Spanish Indonesian
then we would go and say the material
cotton metal and finally the purpose so
a sleeping for like a sleeping bag or a
flower for a flower pot so so this is
the order that we use to lift the
adjectives before a noun but my tip
is we don't tend to list more than three
so use this order pick three of them and
put it before an hour so for example
I've got a red Spanish flamenco dress no
